game.logic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.logic.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The board Class is a class that aims to manage the rest of the logic related Classes proper to the game, its main function is to initialize all the classes and elements needed to start a game. Contain the following attributes:

    tableTop: A 15x15 two dimensional matrix that take Square type objects.

    gameCode: A String value that serves as identifier for the board instance

    playerList: An instance of the PlayerLinkedList Class

    deck: An Array that contains all the LetterTile objects that will be used for the game

    dictionary: An instance of the Dictionary

    turn: An int value that is used as the turn number

    maxPlayers: An integer value that represents the maximum amount of players that can play on an specific instance of the Board Class

    deckSize: An integer value that's initialized on 100, represents the amount of tiles that are not yet distributed to the players, decreases with each turn

    currentConnection: An integer value that represents the amount of players connected to the game by the specific instance of the Board Class.

    playedWords: An instance of the PlayerWordList Class

      • initializeTableTop

        public void initializeTableTop()
        Initialize table top. Reads from the TableTop.txt file that exists on the project root and parses it, the document contains the board multiplier values and places them on a Square object that's positioned on the matrix contained in the tableTop attribute.

      • InitializeDeck

        public void InitializeDeck()
        Initialize deck. Parses the LetterTiles.txt file that exist on the project root folder, the document contains the letters that will be used to create letter tiles the points that each letter tile yields in game and the amount of letter tiles available for each specific letter. Stores all the created letter tiles in the deck attribute of this class

      • generateGameCode

        public void generateGameCode()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Generate game code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
